org.jcvi.jillion.internal.core

Interface GlyphCodec<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the Type of Glyph to be encoded and or decoded.

    public interface GlyphCodec<T>
    GlyphCodec is an interface that allows Glyphs to be encoded and decoded into byte arrays.
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T decode(byte[] encodedGlyphs, long index)
      Get a single Gyph from the encoded byte array at the given index.
      int decodedLengthOf(byte[] encodedGlyphs)
      Get the number of glyphs represented by the encoded byte array.

    • Method Detail

      • decode

        T decode(byte[] encodedGlyphs,
         long index)
        Get a single Gyph from the encoded byte array at the given index.
        Parameters:
        encodedGlyphs - the byte array of encoded glyphs.
        index - the index of the glyph to get.
        Returns:
        the decoded glyph at the given index.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is out of bounds of the index.

      • decodedLengthOf

        int decodedLengthOf(byte[] encodedGlyphs)
        Get the number of glyphs represented by the encoded byte array.
        Parameters:
        encodedGlyphs - the byte array of glyphs.
        Returns:
        an int ≥ 0.
